snippet: Most parents know that their children are legally adults when they turn 18. But the full significance may not be apparent until something drives it home.
abstract: Alina Tugend Shortcuts column points out parents often fail to appreciate full significance of fact that their children become legal adults when they turn 18; notes that having conversation about a child's rights and responsibilities when they turn 18 is a good first step.
lead_paragraph: Most parents know that their children are legally adults when they turn 18. But the full significance may not be apparent until something drives it home.

headline.main: Beyond a Parent’s Reach: When a Child Legally Becomes an Adult
